newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt to get 400,000T Australian wheat in Apl/May.
newsitem.headline: Egypt to get 400,000T Australian wheat in Apl/May.

text.p: Egypt's main commodities buyer said on Wednesday the 400,000 tonnes of soft white Australian wheat Egypt had bought about a month ago from the Australian Wheat Board (AWB) would be shipped in April and May.

Samir Shakankiri, vice chairman of the state's General Authority for Supply Commodities, told Reuters he confirmed an AWB freight offer for 200,000 tonnes of the wheat to be shipped from the beginning of April to April 15.
The other half of the purchase would be shipped in a 100,000 tonne shipment from the beginning of May up to May 5, and another 100,000 tonne shipment from May 5 up to May 10.
"The Egyptian companies failed to match the prices of AWB," Shakankiri said. --Cairo newsroom +202 578 3290/1
